file.title: Split without quotes

p.text: It is used to split any text into parts divided with some symbol or a line and returns the specified part of the text. If a part of text in quotes is found while searching then it ignores this piece and no searching inside of this piece is done.

p.textAll:
Foe example, if we split the text Hi! Friend"!" How do you do? into parts with "!" as a splitter, then the text will be spliy into 'Hi' and 'Friend"!" How do you do?'. And if you specify 2 as the number of the part И you'll get 'Friend"!" How do you do?''.
Often it is necessary to know about how many parts the text was split it. You can get it using the command _Split without quotes count.

file.seealso:
